content.title: H.P. Swaran Jayanti Middle Merit Scholarship Scheme For Govt. Schools
content.department: Department of Elementary Education, Government of Himachal Pradesh
content.details: The scheme 'H.P. Swaran Jayanti Middle Merit Scholarship Scheme for Govt. Schools' was launched by the Department of Elementary Education, Government of Himachal Pradesh for students studying in Class V is meant to identify the talent and nurture it at an early stage. The meritorious students for the award of benefits under the scheme will be selected through a state-level examination. The examination will be conducted every year at the state level by the SCERT, Solan (H.P.). A total of 100 scholarships can be distributed among twelve districts of the State, determining the district quota based on an average of the last three years' enrollment in class five (as per UDISE data of the latest three years) of the Government Schools in the State.
eligibility: All the students studying in Class 5th as regular students in the Government Schools are eligible to apply for the State Level examination to be conducted by the SCERT, Solan (H.P.).
The student must continue to study in the Government School of H.P. Govt. without repeating any class for continuity of scholarship.
It would be mandatory for the student to have at least 75% attendance during the session for which he/she is to be awarded the Scholarship.
In genuine cases of acute illness or any medical exigency, subject to verification by the Medical Board, a condition of 75% attendance will not be applicable.
content.application_process: All the interested eligible students may contact their Class Teacher in the school and collect the application form for the scholarship scheme. The eligible students may fill the forms and submit well in time. All the complete application form for examination will be submitted to the CHT of the school much before the last date of submission. The CHT will verify the documents, eligibility and details of the applicant. After confirmation of the details of the applicant on online portal, the CHTs will be able to download and print the admit cards of the candidates with technical support from BRC (Primary). The class teacher will collect the admit card for their respective students from CHTs. Further, the admit cards will be given to the respective students and the students may appear in the exam on scheduled date & time.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. School ID Card etc.
Any other documents as asked by the school authority

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to identify talented students and nurture them at an early stage who are studying in Class V.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Elementary Education, Government of H.P.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: All the students studying in Class 5th as regular students in the Government Schools are eligible to apply for the State Level examination to be conducted by the SCERT, Solan (H.P.).

faqs.question: Can a general category student be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of students.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The selected students shall be eligible for the scholarship from class 6th to 8th.

faqs.question: How much will the scholarship amount be given to the selected students?
faqs.answer: The scholarship amount of ₹4000/-, ₹5000/- & ₹6000/- per month in Class 6th, Class 7th & Class 8th will be given to the selected students respectively for 12 months.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The duration of the scholarship shall be of three years (Class 6th to Class 8th).

faqs.question: How many numbers of students will be selected for scholarships under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship will be given to 100 students every year.

faqs.question: Will the exam be conducted every year in the state?
faqs.answer: The examination will be conducted every year at the state level by the SCERT, Solan (H.P.).

faqs.question: How will the students be selected under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The meritorious students who are eligible for the award of benefits under the scheme will be selected through a state-level examination.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of examination?
faqs.answer: The state-level examination will comprise one test of 100 marks consisting of 100 multiple-choice questions of one mark each. The question paper will cover mental ability tests, scholastic aptitude tests, and language tests.

faqs.question: Will there be any negative markings in the examination?
faqs.answer: There will be no negative marking in the examination.

faqs.question: What is the condition for the continuity of scholarship?
faqs.answer: The student must continue to study in the Government School of H.P. Govt. without repeating any class. It would be mandatory for the student to have at least 75% attendance during the session for which he/she is to be awarded the Scholarship.

faqs.question: How can a student apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: All the interested eligible students may contact their Class Teacher in the school and collect the application form for the scholarship scheme.
